page.title: 15Local History in Northill
page.content: Northill{*}Norhill{*}Norrill{*}Norrell Norgivele{*}North Givel{*}North Gifell In the{Wixamtree Hundred;}Deadmans Oak at the S. end of Sheerhatch Wood was probable site of Hundred meet.Evidence of{Chantry College,}est.1390 - several fish ponds & field names: College Pond field, College Meadow, College Wood & Backside. Wilmer Hill was the site of a windmill; Cooks Close dates back to 1224. The Barracks housed local troops in the{Napoleonic Wars.}The Iron Room, (Harvey Hall), on the site of the new Village Hall, was built for Â£241 in 1882 by the Rector on land given by Squire Harvey and opened for{Queen {Victoria's Jubilee.}It was replaced in 1974, cost Â£13,000. A pair of houses & some small fields are owned by local {charities}which still make annual cash grants to the poor and needy in the Parish.Old TV mast at Sheerhatch Wood.
